intro: Hymenodictyon decaryi, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. It is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
